subject: Civil Procedure — Subject-Matter Jurisdiction
body: Darren, a Texas citizen, sues Debora, a Louisiana citizen, in federal court for $50,000. Does diversity jurisdiction exist?
options: No — amount in controversy too low

subject: Civil Procedure — Personal Jurisdiction
body: Debora sells one car through Craigslist to a buyer in Virginia. The buyer sues her there over that sale. Does Virginia have specific jurisdiction?
options: Yes — claim arises from forum contact
No — stream of commerce not satisfied

subject: Civil Procedure — Erie Doctrine
body: A federal court in Virginia hears a state-law negligence claim. There’s no federal rule on point. What law governs?

subject: Civil Procedure — Removal
body: Darren sues Debora in Virginia state court. Debora removes to federal court 40 days after service. What result?

subject: Civil Procedure — Summary Judgment
body: After discovery, no genuine dispute exists about any material fact. What should the court do?

subject: Torts — Negligence Duty
body: Debora walks by a stranger drowning in a shallow pond and does nothing. Liability?
options: No — no duty absent special relationship
Yes — moral duty equals legal duty

subject: Torts — Breach
body: Darren drives 10 mph over the limit in a residential area. A child runs into the street and is hit. Which case best captures the analysis?

subject: Torts — Cause in Fact
body: Two negligent hunters fire; one bullet hits Debora. Which doctrine applies?

subject: Torts — Proximate Cause
body: Darren leaves dynamite on his porch. A thief steals it, drops it, and injures Debora two miles away. Result?

subject: Torts — Comparative Fault
body: Debora sues Darren for negligence. Jury finds her 20% at fault. What happens under pure comparative negligence?

subject: Contracts — Offer and Acceptance
body: Darren emails Debora offering to sell a bike for $500. Before she replies, he sells it to another. What result?

subject: Contracts — Consideration
body: Debora promises to give Darren $1,000 for his past help. Is it enforceable?
options: No — past consideration is not valid

subject: Contracts — Statute of Frauds
body: Darren orally agrees to sell land to Debora. She pays and moves in. Enforceable?

subject: Criminal Law — Homicide
body: Darren intends serious injury but accidentally kills Debora. Charge?

subject: Criminal Law — Attempt
body: Debora buys a gun intending to rob a bank but changes her mind before entering. What liability?

subject: Civil Procedure — Personal Jurisdiction
body: Darren, a Virginia resident, sues Debora, a Texas resident, in Virginia state court for a car accident in Texas. Debora has never been to Virginia. Does the court have personal jurisdiction?

subject: Torts — Negligence
body: Darren accidentally leaves a rake on the sidewalk. Debora trips. Which element is most in question?

subject: Civil Procedure — Venue
body: Darren sues Debora for a tort that occurred in Texas. Debora resides in the Southern District of Texas. Proper venue?
options: Any federal district in the U.S.
A district where any defendant resides if all defendants reside in the same state
Only the district where plaintiff resides
Only the district where defendant was served

subject: Civil Procedure — 12(b)(6)
body: Under Twombly/Iqbal, a complaint must contain:
options: Sufficient factual matter to state a plausible claim

subject: Civil Procedure — Service
body: Debora serves Darren by leaving the summons at his dwelling with a co-resident adult. Under Rule 4(e)(2)(B), is service valid?

subject: Torts — Res Ipsa
body: A barrel falls from Debora’s warehouse onto Darren. No direct evidence of negligence. What doctrine helps Darren?

subject: Torts — Eggshell Plaintiff
body: Darren has a fragile skull. A minor bump by Debora causes severe harm. Liability scope?
options: Limit to foreseeable extent of harm
Full liability for actual damages (eggshell rule)
No liability due to unusual susceptibility

subject: Torts — Negligence Per Se
body: Debora violates a safety statute designed to protect a class including Darren from the type of injury he suffered. Effect?
options: Evidence of negligence but not breach
Breach established if statute applies and no excuse

subject: Torts — Landowner Duties
body: Darren is a business invitee at Debora’s store. Standard of care?
options: Warn of known hidden dangers only
Reasonable care to make premises safe (inspect + remedy)

subject: Contracts — Firm Offer (UCC §2-205)
body: Debora, a merchant, signs a writing assuring Darren an offer will be held open for 30 days. Consideration?
options: Not required; writing signed by merchant suffices
Only required if goods are unique

subject: Contracts — Mirror Image / UCC Battle of Forms
body: Under UCC §2-207, a seasonable expression of acceptance with additional terms:
options: Is acceptance only if signed by both parties and sealed

subject: Contracts — Preexisting Duty
body: Darren promises to perform an existing duty for more money from Debora. Common-law consideration?
options: Invalid — no consideration for same duty

subject: Contracts — Promissory Estoppel
body: Debora promises to pay Darren for moving based on her promise; he reasonably relies and moves. If no contract, remedy?
options: Promissory estoppel may enforce to avoid injustice

subject: Criminal Law — Accomplice Liability
body: Darren aids Debora in committing a burglary. What mental state is generally required for accomplice liability?

subject: Criminal Law — Self-Defense
body: Deadly force is justified when Darren reasonably believes:
options: Imminent unlawful deadly force is threatened

subject: Criminal Law — Conspiracy Withdrawal
body: Darren joins a conspiracy but later tells Debora he quits. Liability for prior crimes?
options: Liable for prior foreseeable crimes before withdrawal
Liable for nothing if he says 'I quit'

subject: BigLaw Humor — Billing
body: Policy quiz: How many six-minute increments are in an hour?

subject: Office Humor — Elevator Etiquette
body: If the partner enters the elevator, you:

subject: Filing Humor — PDF Names
body: Correct file naming convention for Darren’s brief?

subject: Love note — Coffee break?
body: Proud of you. Coffee after you crush these questions? ❤️

subject: Love note — You’ve got this
body: Go win that bonus money, counselor. Dinner’s on me. 😘

subject: Love note — Study anthem
body: Playing your focus playlist. Text me your score later. 💪
